comment.body:
> The problem remains to be `ModuleNotFoundError`

You did not mention a `ModuleNotFoundError` error, what is it?

> `ERROR | No such comm target registered: jupyter.widget.control`

This "error" (I'm going to insist putting quotes, it's just a warning 😅) comes from `jupyterlab_widgets` trying to open the `jupyter.widget.control`. If you still see this error, you did not uninstall it properly. Starting from a clean environment could probably help.

issue.title: JupyterLite doesn't display plt plots by default
issue.body:
## Description

This bug was originally found while investigating this PyScript issue: https://github.com/pyscript/pyscript/issues/983

As discussed with @jtpio in real life, the following piece of code behaves differently in Jupyter and JupyterLite: in Jupyter, it displays a plot; in JupyterLite, it displays `<matplotlib.collection.PathsColletion ...>`.

If you add `%matplotlib_inline`, it works as expected.

## Reproduce

```python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Cheukting/pyscript-ice-cream/main/bj-products.csv"

# try to autodetect whether it's jupyter or jupyterlist
try:
    from pyodide.http import open_url
except ImportError:
    print("Normal jupyter")
else:
    print("jupyterlite!")
    url = open_url(url)

df = pd.read_csv(url)
plt.scatter(df['rating'], df['rating_count'])
```

## Expected behavior

Jupyter and JupyterLite should behave the same.

comment.body:
Thanks for opening an issue!

That rings a bell now. We fixed a similar issue in jupyterlite-xeus-python.

If you use normal Jupyter, the inline backend is used by default:
![Screenshot from 2022-12-09 16-41-24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21197331/206738925-6e51c262-30a7-46dc-b007-af341dbb3632.png)

So we mimick the same behavior in xeus-python now: https://github.com/jupyter-xeus/xeus-python-shell/pull/16

I guess we should do the same in pyolite.

issue.title: Reduce the initial download size
issue.body:
<!--
Welcome! Thanks for thinking of a way to improve JupyterLite. If this solves a problem for you, then it probably solves that problem for lots of people! So the whole community will benefit from this request.

Before creating a new feature request please search the issues for relevant feature requests.
-->

### Problem

On the demo website the `xeus-python` files are a bit over 10MB in size:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/591645/177781173-acb543b6-fec9-4b8a-acd4-3a501bd94546.png)

This size can grow quite significantly as more packages are added by default. For example:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/591645/177785737-fbec703d-7a09-4b22-9a13-41662b986fab.png)


### Proposed Solution

Not sure how feasible it is, but maybe there is a way to trim that down a little bit. 

### Additional context

Also raised by @jasongrout in https://github.com/jupyter-widgets/ipywidgets/pull/3491#issuecomment-1177391508.

comment.body: This was done in `empack`, the tool that we use for "packing" the Python environment, we still need to make use of it in `jupyterlite-xeus-python`.

pull_request.title: do not signal `ready` until initialize completes
pull_request.body:
## References

Addresses issue: https://github.com/jupyterlite/jupyterlite/issues/897

## Code changes

Previously the `_ready` promise for the kernel was immediately resolved without awaiting the initialization promise to resolve, now the `_ready` promise resolved after initialization completes.

The effect of this on a frontend like thebe, is that the UI can better signal when the kernel is actually ready -- aligning with behaviour seen with normal jupyter server connections.

## User-facing changes

In jupyterlite apps and thebe, like kernel ready indicator appears later, and shows a status `initializing...` during the package load. Which is the expected user facing change 👍

## Backwards-incompatible changes

none expected

issue.title: Service worker fixes,  JupyterLab 3.5.1
issue.body:
## References

- #871, but without the `pyodide` version change
- #892, but not closed

## Code changes

- [x] add exact-pinned `pyodide` to `pyodide-kernel/package.json#/devDependencies`
  - only ever `import type`d in `.ts`
  - is the source of truth for all other versions
- > ~~bump to [`pyodide 0.22.0a3`](https://github.com/pyodide/pyodide/blob/0.22.0a3/docs/project/changelog.md#unreleased)~~
- [x] add `@types/emscripten` (such as it is)
- [x] remove duplicated `ERRNO_CODES`
- [x] remove use of private `pyodide._module`
- [x] update key dev deps
  - [x] `lerna 6`
  - [x] `typedoc 0.23`
  - [x] `typescript 4.9`
  - [x] `prettier 2.8`    
- [x] refactor `BroadcastChannel` out of server, put in contents
- [x] make pyolite more resilient to missing `ServiceWorker` and `BroadcastChannel` 
- [x] moves `services.js` into `server/sw.ts`
  - [x] add a new webpack plugin to hoist it up to the root of the app (or the scope is wrong) and add the content hash to the file name
- [x] add `SKIP_ESLINT` env var
  - > the pre-commit hooks still fail sometimes, so `git commit -n` it shall be!
- [x] remove `plotly` until compatible with ipywidgets 8
  - > https://github.com/plotly/plotly.py/issues/3686 

## User-facing changes

- site deployers
  - can disable the `ServiceWorker`
- end users
  - should get fewer stale serves of `services.js` with cache-busting

## Backwards-incompatible changes

issue.title: Widget.interact does not work in Pyolite
issue.body:
## Description

With the following code:

```python
import piplite
await piplite.install('ipympl')
```

```python
%matplotlib widget
import ipywidgets as widgets
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

x = np.linspace(0,10)

def sine_func(x, w, amp):
    return amp*np.sin(w*x)

@widgets.interact(w=(0, 4, 0.25), amp=(0, 4, .1))
def update(w = 1, amp = 1):
    plt.clf()
    plt.ylim(-4, 4)
    plt.plot(x, sine_func(x, w, amp))
```

The plot is not updating when moving the slider:
[Screencast from 2022-12-07 17-06-31.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21197331/206230124-2f8573ee-5bbb-4d4d-bc25-7f4dca35050e.webm)

I feel like it's because the pyolite kernel might not support `update_display` properly?

## References

- #871, but without the `pyodide` version change

## Code changes

- [x] add exact-pinned `pyodide` to `pyodide-kernel/package.json#/devDependencies`
  - only ever `import type`d in `.ts`
  - is the source of truth for all other versions
- > ~~bump to [`pyodide 0.22.0a3`](https://github.com/pyodide/pyodide/blob/0.22.0a3/docs/project/changelog.md#unreleased)~~

  - [x] `typedoc`
  - [x] `typescript`
  - [x] `prettier`    
- [x] refactor `BroadcastChannel` out of server, put in contents
- [x] make pyolite more resilient to missing `ServiceWorker` and `BroadcastChannel` 
- [x] moves `services.js` into `server/sw.ts`
  - [x] add a new webpack plugin to hoist it up to the root of the app (or the scope is wrong) and add the content hash to the file name
- [x] add `SKIP_ESLINT` env var
  - > the pre-commit hooks still fail sometimes, so `git commit -n` it shall be!
- [x] remove `plotly` until compatible with ipywidgets 8

comment.body:
Is this interface really bound to Pyodide?

We're using this DriveFS in xeus-python-kernel (and we could technically use it with another language kernel!) and I wonder if this interface does not make it too specific.

issue.title: Voilite POC
issue.body:
POC implementation for Voilite. Building on top of the lab-based PR https://github.com/voila-dashboards/voila/pull/846

This PR implements a Voilite nbconvert exporter that will execute the code in the client using a client-side kernel.

```
jupyter nbconvert --to voilite_dashboard notebooks/basics.ipynb
```

## Update 18/11
The `nbconvert` template is replaced by the `voilite` command. Users can convert a notebook into a static dashboard  page with 
 
```
voilite notebook.ipynb --theme=dark --template=gridstack --packages=ipywidgets --packages=ipyleaflet
```
Supported options: 
- `--theme`: Change the theme , can be `dark`, `light` or the full name of the JupyterLab themes. 
- `--template`: Change the template, for now `Voilite` supports `lab`, `gridstack`, `reveal` and `classic` theme
- `--packages`: List of packages to be installed at run time in the lite kernel. 

`Voilite` can be configured via the CLI or the `voilite.py/voilite.json` file.

Remaining tasks 

- [x]  Update `classic` and `reveal` templates to support `voilite`.
- [x] Handle static files
- [x]  Generate a tree page for the case of multiple notebooks.
- [x]  Improve loading message.
- [ ] ~Add tests and documentation~ (will be addressed in the follow-up PR )

![voilite](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4451292/195892714-15069c3e-3a55-494a-90e6-0efc57b8cd84.gif)

> The problem remains to be `ModuleNotFoundError`

You did not mention a `ModuleNotFoundError` error, what is it?

> `ERROR | No such comm target registered: jupyter.widget.control`

This "error" (I'm going to insist putting quotes, it's just a warning 😅) comes from `jupyterlab_widgets` trying to open the `jupyter.widget.control`. If you still see this error, you did not uninstall it properly. Starting from a clean environment could probably help.

issue.title: JupyterLite doesn't display plt plots by default
issue.body:
## Description

This bug was originally found while investigating this PyScript issue: https://github.com/pyscript/pyscript/issues/983

As discussed with @jtpio in real life, the following piece of code behaves differently in Jupyter and JupyterLite: in Jupyter, it displays a plot; in JupyterLite, it displays `<matplotlib.collection.PathsColletion ...>`.

If you add `%matplotlib_inline`, it works as expected.

## Reproduce

```python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Cheukting/pyscript-ice-cream/main/bj-products.csv"

# try to autodetect whether it's jupyter or jupyterlist
try:
    from pyodide.http import open_url
except ImportError:
    print("Normal jupyter")
else:
    print("jupyterlite!")
    url = open_url(url)

df = pd.read_csv(url)
plt.scatter(df['rating'], df['rating_count'])
```

## Expected behavior

Jupyter and JupyterLite should behave the same.

comment.body:
Thanks for opening an issue!

That rings a bell now. We fixed a similar issue in jupyterlite-xeus-python.

If you use normal Jupyter, the inline backend is used by default:
![Screenshot from 2022-12-09 16-41-24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21197331/206738925-6e51c262-30a7-46dc-b007-af341dbb3632.png)

So we mimick the same behavior in xeus-python now: https://github.com/jupyter-xeus/xeus-python-shell/pull/16

I guess we should do the same in pyolite.

issue.title: Reduce the initial download size
issue.body:
<!--
Welcome! Thanks for thinking of a way to improve JupyterLite. If this solves a problem for you, then it probably solves that problem for lots of people! So the whole community will benefit from this request.

Before creating a new feature request please search the issues for relevant feature requests.
-->

### Problem

On the demo website the `xeus-python` files are a bit over 10MB in size:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/591645/177781173-acb543b6-fec9-4b8a-acd4-3a501bd94546.png)

This size can grow quite significantly as more packages are added by default. For example:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/591645/177785737-fbec703d-7a09-4b22-9a13-41662b986fab.png)


### Proposed Solution

Not sure how feasible it is, but maybe there is a way to trim that down a little bit. 

### Additional context

Also raised by @jasongrout in https://github.com/jupyter-widgets/ipywidgets/pull/3491#issuecomment-1177391508.

comment.body: This was done in `empack`, the tool that we use for "packing" the Python environment, we still need to make use of it in `jupyterlite-xeus-python`.

pull_request.title: do not signal `ready` until initialize completes
pull_request.body:
## References

Addresses issue: https://github.com/jupyterlite/jupyterlite/issues/897

## Code changes

Previously the `_ready` promise for the kernel was immediately resolved without awaiting the initialization promise to resolve, now the `_ready` promise resolved after initialization completes.

The effect of this on a frontend like thebe, is that the UI can better signal when the kernel is actually ready -- aligning with behaviour seen with normal jupyter server connections.

## User-facing changes

In jupyterlite apps and thebe, like kernel ready indicator appears later, and shows a status `initializing...` during the package load. Which is the expected user facing change 👍

## Backwards-incompatible changes

none expected

issue.title: Service worker fixes,  JupyterLab 3.5.1
issue.body:
## References

- #871, but without the `pyodide` version change
- #892, but not closed

## Code changes

- [x] add exact-pinned `pyodide` to `pyodide-kernel/package.json#/devDependencies`
  - only ever `import type`d in `.ts`
  - is the source of truth for all other versions
- > ~~bump to [`pyodide 0.22.0a3`](https://github.com/pyodide/pyodide/blob/0.22.0a3/docs/project/changelog.md#unreleased)~~
- [x] add `@types/emscripten` (such as it is)
- [x] remove duplicated `ERRNO_CODES`
- [x] remove use of private `pyodide._module`
- [x] update key dev deps
  - [x] `lerna 6`
  - [x] `typedoc 0.23`
  - [x] `typescript 4.9`
  - [x] `prettier 2.8`    
- [x] refactor `BroadcastChannel` out of server, put in contents
- [x] make pyolite more resilient to missing `ServiceWorker` and `BroadcastChannel` 
- [x] moves `services.js` into `server/sw.ts`
  - [x] add a new webpack plugin to hoist it up to the root of the app (or the scope is wrong) and add the content hash to the file name
- [x] add `SKIP_ESLINT` env var
  - > the pre-commit hooks still fail sometimes, so `git commit -n` it shall be!
- [x] remove `plotly` until compatible with ipywidgets 8
  - > https://github.com/plotly/plotly.py/issues/3686 

## User-facing changes

- site deployers
  - can disable the `ServiceWorker`
- end users
  - should get fewer stale serves of `services.js` with cache-busting

## Backwards-incompatible changes

- some Emscripten-related types and classes have moved
- the name of `services.js` is no longer predictable (hash-based)

issue.title: Latest version break IPyWidgets
issue.body:
IPyKernel Version: 6.19.0
Install Jupyter and ipywidgets 
Run a notebook with the following code

```python
import ipywidgets as widgets
widgets.IntSlider()
```

Slider is not renderered
Here is the error message
```
A Jupyter widget could not be displayed because the widget state could not be found. 
This could happen if the kernel storing the widget is no longer available, or if the widget state was not saved in the notebook. 
You may be able to create the widget by running the appropriate cells.
```

pull_request.title: Service worker fixes
pull_request.body:
## References

- #871, but without the `pyodide` version change

## Code changes

- [x] add exact-pinned `pyodide` to `pyodide-kernel/package.json#/devDependencies`
  - only ever `import type`d in `.ts`
  - is the source of truth for all other versions
- > ~~bump to [`pyodide 0.22.0a3`](https://github.com/pyodide/pyodide/blob/0.22.0a3/docs/project/changelog.md#unreleased)~~
- [x] remove duplicated `ERRNO_CODES`
- [x] remove use of private `pyodide._module`
- [x] update key dev deps
  - [x] `lerna 6`
  - [x] `typedoc`
  - [x] `typescript`
  - [x] `prettier`    
- [x] refactor `BroadcastChannel` out of server, put in contents
- [x] make pyolite more resilient to missing `ServiceWorker` and `BroadcastChannel` 
- [x] moves `services.js` into `server/sw.ts`
  - [x] add a new webpack plugin to hoist it up to the root of the app (or the scope is wrong) and add the content hash to the file name
- [x] add `SKIP_ESLINT` env var
  - > the pre-commit hooks still fail sometimes, so `git commit -n` it shall be!
- [x] remove `plotly` until compatible with ipywidgets 8
  - > https://github.com/plotly/plotly.py/issues/3686 

## User-facing changes

<!-- Describe any visual or user interaction changes and how they address the issue. -->

<!-- For visual changes, include before and after screenshots here. -->

<!-- Describe any backwards-incompatible changes to JupyterLite public APIs. -->

issue.title: Widget.interact does not work in Pyolite
issue.body:
## Description

With the following code:

```python
import piplite
await piplite.install('ipympl')
```

```python
%matplotlib widget
import ipywidgets as widgets
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

x = np.linspace(0,10)

def sine_func(x, w, amp):
    return amp*np.sin(w*x)

@widgets.interact(w=(0, 4, 0.25), amp=(0, 4, .1))
def update(w = 1, amp = 1):
    plt.clf()
    plt.ylim(-4, 4)
    plt.plot(x, sine_func(x, w, amp))
```

The plot is not updating when moving the slider:
[Screencast from 2022-12-07 17-06-31.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21197331/206230124-2f8573ee-5bbb-4d4d-bc25-7f4dca35050e.webm)

I feel like it's because the pyolite kernel might not support `update_display` properly?

issue.title: Voilite POC
issue.body:
POC implementation for Voilite. Building on top of the lab-based PR https://github.com/voila-dashboards/voila/pull/846

This PR implements a Voilite nbconvert exporter that will execute the code in the client using a client-side kernel.

```
jupyter nbconvert --to voilite_dashboard notebooks/basics.ipynb
```

## Update 18/11
The `nbconvert` template is replaced by the `voilite` command. Users can convert a notebook into a static dashboard  page with 
 
```
voilite notebook.ipynb --theme=dark --template=gridstack --packages=ipywidgets --packages=ipyleaflet
```
Supported options: 
- `--theme`: Change the theme , can be `dark`, `light` or the full name of the JupyterLab themes. 
- `--template`: Change the template, for now `Voilite` supports `lab`, `gridstack`, `reveal` and `classic` theme
- `--packages`: List of packages to be installed at run time in the lite kernel. 

`Voilite` can be configured via the CLI or the `voilite.py/voilite.json` file.

Remaining tasks 

- [x]  Update `classic` and `reveal` templates to support `voilite`.
- [x] Handle static files
- [x]  Generate a tree page for the case of multiple notebooks.
- [x]  Improve loading message.
- [ ] ~Add tests and documentation~ (will be addressed in the follow-up PR )

![voilite](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4451292/195892714-15069c3e-3a55-494a-90e6-0efc57b8cd84.gif)

comment.body:
> The problem remains to be `ModuleNotFoundError`

You did not mention a `ModuleNotFoundError` error, what is it?

> `ERROR | No such comm target registered: jupyter.widget.control`

This "error" (I'm going to insist putting quotes, it's just a warning 😅) comes from `jupyterlab_widgets` trying to open the `jupyter.widget.control`. If you still see this error, you did not uninstall it properly. Starting from a clean environment could probably help.

issue.title: JupyterLite doesn't display plt plots by default
issue.body:
## Description

This bug was originally found while investigating this PyScript issue: https://github.com/pyscript/pyscript/issues/983

As discussed with @jtpio in real life, the following piece of code behaves differently in Jupyter and JupyterLite: in Jupyter, it displays a plot; in JupyterLite, it displays `<matplotlib.collection.PathsColletion ...>`.

If you add `%matplotlib_inline`, it works as expected.

## Reproduce

```python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Cheukting/pyscript-ice-cream/main/bj-products.csv"

# try to autodetect whether it's jupyter or jupyterlist
try:
    from pyodide.http import open_url
except ImportError:
    print("Normal jupyter")
else:
    print("jupyterlite!")
    url = open_url(url)

df = pd.read_csv(url)
plt.scatter(df['rating'], df['rating_count'])
```

## Expected behavior

Jupyter and JupyterLite should behave the same.

comment.body:
Thanks for opening an issue!

That rings a bell now. We fixed a similar issue in jupyterlite-xeus-python.

If you use normal Jupyter, the inline backend is used by default:
![Screenshot from 2022-12-09 16-41-24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21197331/206738925-6e51c262-30a7-46dc-b007-af341dbb3632.png)

So we mimick the same behavior in xeus-python now: https://github.com/jupyter-xeus/xeus-python-shell/pull/16

I guess we should do the same in pyolite.

issue.title: Reduce the initial download size
issue.body:
<!--
Welcome! Thanks for thinking of a way to improve JupyterLite. If this solves a problem for you, then it probably solves that problem for lots of people! So the whole community will benefit from this request.

Before creating a new feature request please search the issues for relevant feature requests.
-->

### Problem

On the demo website the `xeus-python` files are a bit over 10MB in size:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/591645/177781173-acb543b6-fec9-4b8a-acd4-3a501bd94546.png)

This size can grow quite significantly as more packages are added by default. For example:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/591645/177785737-fbec703d-7a09-4b22-9a13-41662b986fab.png)


### Proposed Solution

Not sure how feasible it is, but maybe there is a way to trim that down a little bit. 

### Additional context

Also raised by @jasongrout in https://github.com/jupyter-widgets/ipywidgets/pull/3491#issuecomment-1177391508.

comment.body: This was done in `empack`, the tool that we use for "packing" the Python environment, we still need to make use of it in `jupyterlite-xeus-python`.

pull_request.title: do not signal `ready` until initialize completes
pull_request.body:
## References

Addresses issue: https://github.com/jupyterlite/jupyterlite/issues/897

## Code changes

Previously the `_ready` promise for the kernel was immediately resolved without awaiting the initialization promise to resolve, now the `_ready` promise resolved after initialization completes.

The effect of this on a frontend like thebe, is that the UI can better signal when the kernel is actually ready -- aligning with behaviour seen with normal jupyter server connections.

## User-facing changes

In jupyterlite apps and thebe, like kernel ready indicator appears later, and shows a status `initializing...` during the package load. Which is the expected user facing change 👍

## Backwards-incompatible changes

none expected

issue.title: Service worker fixes,  JupyterLab 3.5.1
issue.body:
## References

- #871, but without the `pyodide` version change
- #892, but not closed

## Code changes

- [x] add exact-pinned `pyodide` to `pyodide-kernel/package.json#/devDependencies`
  - only ever `import type`d in `.ts`
  - is the source of truth for all other versions
- > ~~bump to [`pyodide 0.22.0a3`](https://github.com/pyodide/pyodide/blob/0.22.0a3/docs/project/changelog.md#unreleased)~~
- [x] add `@types/emscripten` (such as it is)
- [x] remove duplicated `ERRNO_CODES`
- [x] remove use of private `pyodide._module`
- [x] update key dev deps
  - [x] `lerna 6`
  - [x] `typedoc 0.23`
  - [x] `typescript 4.9`
  - [x] `prettier 2.8`    
- [x] refactor `BroadcastChannel` out of server, put in contents
- [x] make pyolite more resilient to missing `ServiceWorker` and `BroadcastChannel` 
- [x] moves `services.js` into `server/sw.ts`
  - [x] add a new webpack plugin to hoist it up to the root of the app (or the scope is wrong) and add the content hash to the file name
- [x] add `SKIP_ESLINT` env var
  - > the pre-commit hooks still fail sometimes, so `git commit -n` it shall be!
- [x] remove `plotly` until compatible with ipywidgets 8
  - > https://github.com/plotly/plotly.py/issues/3686 

## User-facing changes

- site deployers
  - can disable the `ServiceWorker`
- end users
  - should get fewer stale serves of `services.js` with cache-busting

## Backwards-incompatible changes

- some Emscripten-related types and classes have moved
- the name of `services.js` is no longer predictable (hash-based)

issue.title: Widget.interact does not work in Pyolite
issue.body:
## Description

With the following code:

```python
import piplite
await piplite.install('ipympl')
```

```python
%matplotlib widget
import ipywidgets as widgets
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

x = np.linspace(0,10)

def sine_func(x, w, amp):
    return amp*np.sin(w*x)

@widgets.interact(w=(0, 4, 0.25), amp=(0, 4, .1))
def update(w = 1, amp = 1):
    plt.clf()
    plt.ylim(-4, 4)
    plt.plot(x, sine_func(x, w, amp))
```

The plot is not updating when moving the slider:
[Screencast from 2022-12-07 17-06-31.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21197331/206230124-2f8573ee-5bbb-4d4d-bc25-7f4dca35050e.webm)

I feel like it's because the pyolite kernel might not support `update_display` properly?

issue.title: Voilite POC
issue.body:
POC implementation for Voilite. Building on top of the lab-based PR https://github.com/voila-dashboards/voila/pull/846

This PR implements a Voilite nbconvert exporter that will execute the code in the client using a client-side kernel.

```
jupyter nbconvert --to voilite_dashboard notebooks/basics.ipynb
```

## Update 18/11
The `nbconvert` template is replaced by the `voilite` command. Users can convert a notebook into a static dashboard  page with 
 
```
voilite notebook.ipynb --theme=dark --template=gridstack --packages=ipywidgets --packages=ipyleaflet
```
Supported options: 
- `--theme`: Change the theme , can be `dark`, `light` or the full name of the JupyterLab themes. 
- `--template`: Change the template, for now `Voilite` supports `lab`, `gridstack`, `reveal` and `classic` theme
- `--packages`: List of packages to be installed at run time in the lite kernel. 

`Voilite` can be configured via the CLI or the `voilite.py/voilite.json` file.

Remaining tasks 

- [x]  Update `classic` and `reveal` templates to support `voilite`.
- [x] Handle static files
- [x]  Generate a tree page for the case of multiple notebooks.
- [x]  Improve loading message.
- [ ] ~Add tests and documentation~ (will be addressed in the follow-up PR )

![voilite](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4451292/195892714-15069c3e-3a55-494a-90e6-0efc57b8cd84.gif)
